block.p: Belgrade's Uncertain Future It is unclear how the Yugoslav president, Slobodan Milosevic, will react if he loses the election today or how the people will react if they believe he won by fraud.
Belgrade's Uncertain Future It is unclear how the Yugoslav president, Slobodan Milosevic, will react if he loses the election today or how the people will react if they believe he won by fraud.

Sleight of Hand in Peru Peru's president, Alberto K. Fujimori, has promised to dismantle his spy agency, but with a system that runs on personal rather than institutional power, it is unclear whether things will change.
The Virtual Museum More than 5,000 museums have sites on the Internet, and a worldwide tour among them reveals great confusion and great promise.

Hiding From the Past ''When We Were Orphans,'' the new novel by Kazuo Ishiguro, the author of ''The Remains of the Day,'' looks like a detective novel but is really a flight from freedom, a quest after an identity immune from reality. Reviewed by Michael Gorra.
Late-Night Politics Comedians are becoming as influential as news anchors, and a political joke may reverberate all the way to the voting booth.
Fall Fashion With grown-up looks ranging from sophisticated suits to the return of black to rugged tweeds for the daring explorer in every man, fall fashion comes of age.
Starting Their Engines After a nine-year hiatus, Formula One Grand Prix auto racing will return to the United States.
